post.content:
Purpose  
The position belongs to a development team that develops, maintains, and supports applications for Scotia Capital, primarily in Scotia Capital Finance, Securities Operations, and Group Treasury areas. The incumbent will be reporting to the development manager and the project manager. The candidate will participate in project meetings and business requirement analytics. Hence the candidate must interact effectively with other functional teams in the Department such as Business Analysts, Database Administrators, Change Control, and Production Support. It is essential that the incumbent be proactive and eager to learn.  

Complexity of Position  
At least 3 years of experience in developing applications with Visual Studio 2003/2005
At least 3 years of experience and strong knowledge with MS-SQL and/or Oracle
Good knowledge and working experience in C#, ASP.NET
Knowledge and programming experience in Java, JSP, MQ and UNIX an valuable asset
Good working knowledge in object oriented programming
Good working knowledge in secure web application development
Disciplined in development methodology and knowlegde of full development life cycle.
Familiar with source code version control process
Finance and banking experience an asset
Self-starter and be able to handle multiple tasks and priorities
Strong communication and interpersonal skill
Strong analytical and problem solving skills to provide effective user support
Must be flexible to adapt to a dynamic environment.


Skills  
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related disciplines  

Key Accountabilities  
Participate in the development and support of cost effective and efficient applications or prototypes of low to medium complexity according to standards to meet the demands of the high availability, complex, on-line transaction processing environment. This involves participating in the system design, developing the required programs, performing unit testing and participating in the integrated system tests.

Provide production and user acceptance testing application support to assigned applications by identifying, evaluating and resolving problems of low to medium complexity and escalating to management as per documented procedures. The incumbent is required to carry a beeper to provide timely user support.

Participate in the implementation of new systems or enhancements by running required conversion programs, performing shakedown testing of the production environments, preparing the Change Control Release documentation and running the parallel test cycles.

Keep current on rapidly changing technological trends, self teach new technologies and maintain a broad understanding of the Division's business and technology strategies.
